While Danger Close developed the singleplayer using Unreal Engine 3, online duties have been assumed by Battlefield devs DICE using their own Frostbite 2.0 engine, which was behind this year's earlier shooter hit Bad Company 2. Multiplayer is fun and fast-paced, and the gunplay occupies an interesting gray area between the twitchy shooting of Modern Warfare and the more strategic use of terrain and positioning of Bad Company 2.

When you run the game are you getting a message saying: You are running version XX and you need to update to version XX or you can't play the game?

Here's some advice, you are clicking on the wrong Icon. The icon that the game makes on Desktop or Games Explorer actually runs the MohUpdater.exe file first before load Moh.exe.  Do NOT update your game, it may cause issues.

To fix this just delete that Icon that the install made and go to the Game's directory into the Binaries folder and make your own shortcut to the MOH.EXE file. TADA!!!! You can now play the game. At least that's what worked for me, hope it works for you too.

P.S. Oh ya, use the TRIVIUM crack it works and I found no viruses.  The TRiViUM torrent also contains a keygen.  Hope that helps.
